TopicTitle: What Will You Do When 0.21 Hits?

Articles.Content:
Like in the title what will you do when 0.21 hits?

Me, i'm going to record my first time playing it and post it on youtube.

:sticktongue::sticktongue:
Nothing as it will never come out.

think there is a thread or 2 about this already.

I am going to check out the mun and probably re-build my station
Play with planes, a lot. I can't for the life of me learn to fly them with a keyboard, the new ASAS is supposed to make this much easier.

Nothing as it will never come out.

This isn't HL3 ... :3

Just sayin.
Mmmm... Study the persistence file format so I can see what changes need to be made to old stuff I want to drop into it.

Nothing as it will never come out.

True. It's been cancelled and sold to EA.
I'll probably play it... or not... nah, I'm gonna play it.

copy D:\Games\KSP_win D:\Games\KSP_2

unzip C:\Downloads\KSP_win.zip D:\Games\

Actually that's a lie, the first thing I'll do is download the zip, then I'll do the above.
I'm going to delete all my saves, mods and start all over again. When I have the time. It is summer here. Have lots more to do then sit in front of a computer.
Continue playing my copy of .20 until all the mods I care for are compatible

Since there aren't any mods I care about that might be incompatible (I mean, KSPX is slowly getting integrated anyway, and the Subassembly system is in active enough hands that I think I'll have enough on my plate until I need it), I will be most occupied testing the limits of the new ASAS, primarily with SSTO spaceplanes, and stations constructed out of them.
Im going to download it, while dancing with extreme excitement.
Buzz the tower.
Gonna transfer my saved craft files ... and start again

1) Fire up the patcher

1B) If 1 fails, then I'll go to the KSP store

2) Wait for it to download

3) See if the save file converter works on my save

4) Mess around with the new features
I'll get a habitation module to Minmus.

3) See if the save file converter works on my save

!?!??!?

Where! Gimme-gimme-gimme!

1:mess about with the new parts

2:explore new moon in rover

3:plane stuff

4:Eve athmoprobe

5:study duna`s poles

6:circumnavigate minmus

7:make a SSTO

8:jolian space station

9:return from eeloo

10:duna base
Start over, experiment with the revised stock parts, and wait for my favourite mods to get updated. Then, more stuff. And shenanigans.
Check out the new Mun and the Jool system. Its been 7 months since I've been to the latter one ... !

As soon as I get the new update, I'm gonna make it my ultimate goal to travel, plant a flag, and return from every planet in the system, discluding Jool. But first, I'm gonna test to see if any of my favorite mods will work in the new version.

Explore the new space center, and check out the dirt runway island in hope that they've fixed it, since what was in the preview videos there didn't look good.

Probably finish thinking up the rest of my story about the changes to the space center, but I may need to wait for a bit, incase a mod I need gets broken.

I will also make my traditional run to the Mun, with any new parts stuck on wherever.

Gotta get to know them somehow.

I'll start a new career and consider the old one to be "in simulation" for the "real" space effort. And I'll take another crack at making an Orion drive spacecraft as maybe the improved ASAS won't cause that 8000T barge to shake itself apart when maneuvering in trans-Minmar space.

-- Steve

1. Download the ZIP file for Windows

2. UnZIP said ZIP file.

3. Opened the file and click on the kerbal guy.

4. Wait for the game to load.

5. Click play.

6. Click new game.

7. *Insert some kind of name for the save*

8. Admire the new space center.

9. Make a rocket that would normally fall apart from using SAS.

10. Fly the rocket with SAS on.

11. See if it falls apart.

12. Fly a space plane.

13. Turn around and fly at the control tower.

14. ???

15. Kerbal terrorism.

16. Notice no harm was done what so ever to anybody because the control tower is invincible.
